00052 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
00053 |                                    Init                                      |
00054 +------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
00055 | Description:                                                                                                                             |
00056 |    Initializes the Log system, opens the specific file and writes basic info |
00057 |    to it such as date, and time...                                                   |
00058 | Arguments:                                                                                                                               |
00059 |  - const char *szFileName - file name                                                            |
00060 | Return value:                                                                                                                            |
00061 |    true if everything goes ok, unless false                                                              |
00062 +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00063 bool CLog::Init(const char *szFileName) {
00064         strcpy_s(m_szFileName, szFileName);
00065 
00066         // open clean file and write some basic info:
00067         FILE *f;
00068         fopen_s(&f, m_szFileName, "w+");
00069 
00070         if (f == NULL)
00071                 return false;
00072 
00073         m_bEnabled = true;
00074 
00075         // date and time:
00076         char timestring[280];
00077         __time64_t ltime;
00078 
00079     _time64( &ltime );
00080         _ctime64_s(timestring, &ltime);
00081     //sprintf_s(timestring, "%s",  );
00082 
00083     // module name:
00084         char szModuleName[128];
00085         GetModuleFileName(NULL, szModuleName, 128);
00086         fprintf(f, "<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN\">\n"
00087                            "<HTML>\n"
00088                            "<HEAD>\n"
00089                            "<meta http-equiv=\"content-type\" content=\"text/html; charset=iso-8859-2\">"
00090                            "<TITLE>Log File</TITLE>\n"
00091                            "</HEAD>"
00092                            "<BODY bgcolor=\"FFFFFF\">\n");
00093 
00094         fprintf(f, "<font style=\"font-size: medium; font-family: Courier; color: 4444ee\"> Log for the \"%s\" started!</font><br>\n", szModuleName);
00095         fprintf(f, "<font style=\"font-size: medium; font-family: Courier; color: 4444ee\"> Date and time: %s </font><br>\n", timestring);
00096         fprintf(f, "</BODY>\n"
00097                        "</HTML>\n");
00098 
00099         fclose(f);
00100         return true;
00101 }
00102 
00103 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
00104 |                                   AddMsg                                     |
00105 +------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
00106 | Description:                                                                                                                             |
00107 |    Writes MSG into the log file.                                                                                         |
00108 |                                                                                                              |
00109 | Arguments:                                                                                                                               |
00110 |  - LOG_MODE lmMode - type of the message (Error, Normal, or Success)         |
00111 |  - char *szMsg - message string with argumets ( ... )                        |
00112 | Return value:                                                                                                                            |
00113 |    none                                                                                                      |
00114 +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00115 void CLog::AddMsg(LOG_MODE lmMode, char *szMsg, ...) {
00116         if (m_bEnabled == false)
00117                 return;
00118         
00119         FILE *f;
00120         fopen_s(&f, m_szFileName, "r+");
00121         if (f == NULL)
00122                 return;
00123 
00124         // parse argument to the string:
00125         char buf[512];
00126 
00127         va_list arglist;
00128 
00129         if (!szMsg)
00130                 return;
00131 
00132         va_start(arglist, szMsg);
00133         vsprintf_s(buf, szMsg, arglist);
00134         va_end(arglist);
00135 
00136         // overwrite last 16 characters - that is "</BODY>\n"..."
00137         fseek(f, -18, SEEK_END);
00138         fprintf(f, "<font style=\"font-size: small; font-family: Courier; color: %s\"> %s  </font><br> \n", GetColorName(lmMode), buf);
00139         fprintf(f, "</BODY>\n"
00140                        "</HTML>\n");
00141 
00142 
00143         fclose(f);
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
00147 |                                GetColorName                                  |
00148 +------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
00149 | Description:                                                                                                                             |
00150 |    Decodes LOG_MODE into the color used in HTML file                                     |
00151 |                                                                                                              |
00152 | Arguments:                                                                                                                               |
00153 |  - LOG_MODE lmMode - type of the message (Error, Normal, or Success)         |
00154 | Return value:                                                                                                                            |
00155 |    array of char that represent color fe. "ffeeff"                                               |
00156 +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00157 const char *CLog::GetColorName(LOG_MODE lmMode) {
00158         return LogColors[(int)lmMode];
00159 }
